title: Center of mass - velocities of two spheres at peak

content.question: When the center of mass is at the peak of the trajectory, which of the following best represents the velocities <math alttext="v sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math> and <math alttext="v sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> of the spheres of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="2 m sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, respectively?

choices.label: The figure shows two vectors. A vector labeled v sub 1 extends downward and to the right from the smaller sphere. A slightly shorter vector labeled v sub 2 extends upward and to the right from the larger sphere.

The figure shows two vectors. A vector labeled v sub 1 extends downward and to the right from the smaller sphere. A much shorter vector labeled v sub 2 extends slightly downward and to the right from the larger sphere.

The figure shows two vectors. A vector labeled v sub 1 extends horizontally to the right from the smaller sphere. A vector of the same size labeled v sub 2 extends horizontally to the right from the larger sphere.

The figure shows two vectors. A vector labeled v sub 1 extends vertically downward from the smaller sphere. A significantly shorter vector labeled v sub 2 extends vertically upward from the larger sphere.

content.answer: The figure shows two vectors. A vector labeled v sub 1 extends downward and to the right from the smaller sphere. A slightly shorter vector labeled v sub 2 extends upward and to the right from the larger sphere.
